Posts.Content: Sheilaps wrote: I had a lumpectomy and diagnosis in November 2007 and am still vibrating from the effects of all the chemo and radiation.  I found a lump in my OTHER breast two days ago and saw my oncologist today.  I am getting a mammogram and a ultrasound tomorrow.  My cancer was triple negative.  I feel like it is likely that this lump will have the same results as it has the same characteristics as the first one.  Does anyone know of a triple negative cancer showing up again in the other breast?   Oh good greif. Dx 2/20/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New lump, other breast... Sheilaps Sheilaps

Posts.Content: Sheilaps wrote: I am one month out of my chemo and radiation treatments.  After my lumpectomy, had four chemo sessions of taxol, adriamiacen and nevlasta and four of cytoxan and nevlasta.  I then had six weeks of radiation. I am experiencing treatment induced menopause and am on effexor to lessen the intensity of the hot flashes.  Some of the flashes feel like a  million little pin pricks all over!  This  occured before I started the effexor.  None of my doctors have heard of this as a side effect. This can be sometimes annoying and sometimes pretty painful. Is this or has this happened to anyone else?  Oh good greif. Dx 2/20/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stinging hot flashes anyone? Sheilaps mamakaren

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2008 01:42AM Sheilaps wrote: Thank you for your response, wishiwere! Its not so much itchy as stingy.  Maybe it could lessen to itchy? I am hoping it is more of a menopause effect than some creepy detox effect which is what i am kind of feeling like it is. The effexor has definately helped with the intensity of the flashes. Not the frequency.
Posts.Title: Stinging hot flashes anyone? Sheilaps mamakaren
